column5: So i am driving up the ramp this morning on my way to work and there is this truck in front of me going up the ramp as well. As we both merge on expressway and start speeding up, this huge sheet of snow and ice flies off of his rig and lands right on me, busts my wiper and dents my windshield. I was going about 80 at the time and it was really wet and i couldnt have just stopped or tried to avoid it and i wasnt going fast enough to merge to the left lane and dodge it, last thing i wanted to do was make somebody rearend me and total 2 cars maybe. I was lucky enough that my wipers were working and wiped snow and ice and slush of my windshield fast enough and i didnt end up in a ditch somewhere. Now the rant is.. Guy didnt even stop to see if I am ok, not sure if he saw sheet of ice flying off his rig or not BUT is it so hard to clean the rigs??? I see it happen all the time and its really dangerous! Why dont these transportion companies hire someone just to go from a rig to a rig and clean them after the snow storms???
This is one of my peeves too.  I commute on the 401 every day and there is always someone with flying snow/ice driving down the road.
but it saves me from having to clear it manually....LOL  yeah on the 400 highways they should clear the snow off their cars and trucks

haha I knew we had some truckers in here. Same with trucks transporting gravel and stuff like that lol. On my old car iI had 4 marble size dents in my windshield just from driving on 401 lol, kinda suprised the windshield held up for as long as it did.
Could we see a picture of the dented windshield?

i have been hit with flying ice of a transport before.  it sure isnt fun.  I dont think its possible to clear it off those big rigs but sure wish there was a simple way.  Glad you didnt get hurt!  Cheers!
That was what I was asking myself

That kinda thing happens everywhere.  Seen it many times myself.  Not only from big rigs, but cars, SUV's, pickups ... you name it.   I guess as long as the windows are somewhat clear ... that's good enough.  We got hit with a piece of ice from another car just this past Saturday ... fortunately, no damage.   Hit right on the windshield in front of my wife.

This happened today in Ottawa...   Ice Slams Into Car Window, Narrowly Misses Driver  A driver got a scare after a chunk of ice flew off the top of a transport truck and smashed through a car's windshield on Hwy. 417 near the Nicholas off-ramp today during the lunch hour.  Provincial police said the driver was not hurt, but was shaken up after the large piece of ice came free off the truck and hit the car that was travelling behind. The chunk slammed through the windshield and wound up inside the car, said police.  The driver managed to pull off to the side and was awaiting a tow truck.   Safe Driving,  Justin
Better a sheet of ice flying off of a truck than a 40' log like we get up here. You should see the windshield dent that a 40' log makes.
I always worried a lot about a moose through my windshield. But a chunk of ice could be deadly too.

I`ve seen the dents that a 40' log makes, only on tv LOL. I also saw moose and deer go right through the windshield, thats some scary stuff right there as well. I saw a video, this guy hit a moose but didnt kill it. Moose`s behind went through the windshield and they had to sedate it to pull it out lol. he looked like one ticked off moose.
